acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96-hour LC50=100000microg/L of fishes (Bluegill) (MOE Risk Assessment No.1, 2002).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since the rabbit dermal toxicity value was 17,600mg/kg (RTECS (2004)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on the rat inhalation test toxicity value of 391ppm (1.85mg/L) (ACGIH (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: It was classified as Category 3 with the rat inhalation toxicity value of 2000ppm (ACGIH (2001)). Since it was 90% or less of saturated vapor concentrations, it was classified based on gas standard value.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: The rat oral toxicity value was 14.13g/kg  (ACGIH (2001)), and it was set as the outside of Category.

aspiration_hazard.rationale: The dynamic viscosity at 20 degree C is 0.838mm [2/sec] (calculatd value). Since we have no animal data of chemical pneumonia, we could not classify it.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 98% (IUCLID, 2000)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=1.78 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: There is information that it can carry with a metal container by IMDGcode (Packing Instruction is P001).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: In the in vitro examination it gave the negative result, however, there was no in vivo test result. Therefore we presupposed that we could not classify it according to the technical guideline.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: It is danger of fire (class3) in the UN Recommendations.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: MOE Risk Assessment The 3rd volume (2002) and ACGIH (2001) are coming from the same reference. Since significant differences were not observed as compared with the control, it was assumed as the outside of Category.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: It was decided that it could not be classified since there is no data.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Corneal opacity recovery on the second day, iris was not seeing impact, and redness of the conjunctive had recovered on the 7th day and 14th day. So it was taken as Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since there was a report of mild skin irritation on humans (ACGIH (2001)), it was classified as Category 3.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since the 3rd volume of MOE Risk Assessment  (2002) does not recognize skin sensitization, it was put outside of the Category.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (central nervous system),
Category 2 (lung),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (central nervous system)
May cause damage to organs (lung)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Pulmonary edemas was seen by the central nerves Category 1in human data (ACGIH (2001)), and was seen in the range of the guidance value of Cateory 2 by animal studies. So it was set as Category 2, and it is classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritation).
